title: 111_hr5939
content: The "No Taxpayer Funding for Abortion Act" prohibits the use of federal funds for abortions and health benefits plans that cover abortion. SEC. 302 prohibits federal funds from being used for health benefits plans that cover abortion. SEC. 303 prohibits tax benefits related to abortion. No tax credit allowed for amounts paid for abortion or health benefits plans covering abortion. Expenses for abortion not deductible for medical care. Tax-preferred trusts cannot pay for abortion expenses. Any amount paid or distributed from a tax-preferred trust for an abortion shall be included in the gross income of the beneficiary. The text chunk discusses limitations on federal facilities and employees providing abortion services. It also mentions that individuals, entities, or states can purchase separate abortion coverage as long as it is paid for with non-federal funds. The text chunk outlines that non-federal funds can be used for abortion coverage by health benefits providers, as long as federal funds are not used. It also states that other federal laws regarding abortion funding limitations remain unaffected by the regulations in this chapter. SEC. 308 states that no State or local government is required to provide or pay for abortions or abortion coverage. SEC. 309 exempts abortions in cases of rape, incest, or when the mother's life is in danger. SEC. 310 clarifies that funds approved by Congress for the District of Columbia are included in references to funds appropriated by Federal law. It also defines the District of Columbia government as part of the Federal government. SEC. 311 prohibits government discrimination against certain health care entities. SEC. 311 prohibits discrimination against health care entities that do not provide, pay for, or refer for abortions. The Office for Civil Rights of the Department of Health and Human Services handles complaints related to this issue. SEC. 312 defines 'health benefits coverage' as the services provided by a managed care provider under a contract.
